questions.question: Secure version of HTTP with encryption.
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses SSL/TLS to encrypt data transmitted between browser and server.

questions.question: Protocol used to retrieve emails from a server.
questions.explanation: POP3 and IMAP are protocols for receiving emails.

questions.question: Protocol for transferring files between computers.
questions.explanation: FTP is used to upload and download files.

questions.question: Top-level domain for commercial websites.
questions.explanation: .com is the most common domain extension for businesses.

questions.question: Network of private servers used to deliver web content faster.
questions.explanation: CDNs cache content at multiple locations for faster access.

questions.question: Small text files stored on your computer by websites.
questions.explanation: Cookies store user preferences and session information.

questions.question: Internet connection type using telephone lines.
questions.explanation: DSL provides broadband internet over phone lines.

questions.question: Wireless networking technology for local area networks.
questions.explanation: Wi-Fi allows devices to connect to networks wirelessly.

questions.question: Private IP address range commonly used in home networks.
questions.explanation: 192.168.0.0/16 is a reserved private IP range.

questions.question: Standard port number for HTTP connections.
questions.explanation: Port 80 is the default for unencrypted web traffic.
